title: Amendment to Allow Olympic Sports Complex in Essex County on State Forest Preserve Land
summary_plain_language: This amendment would allow new Nordic ski and biathlon trails on state forest preserve land at the Mount Van Hoevenberg Olympic Sports Complex in Essex County. The project covers up to 323 acres of trails on a 1,039-acre site. The State must acquire at least 2,500 acres of new forest land as an offset before the project can proceed. Legislative approval is required.
abstract_official: The proposal amends the State Constitution to permit new Nordic ski and biathlon trails in the forest preserve as part of the Olympic Sports Complex in North Elba, Essex County. Up to 323 acres of trails and related facilities may be developed. The State must add 2,500 new acres to the forest preserve as an offset, with legislative approval, or the project cannot proceed.
yes_vote_meaning: A YES vote authorizes the creation of new ski trails and related facilities in the Adirondack forest preserve at the Olympic Sports Complex, with the requirement that the State adds 2,500 acres of new forest land.
no_vote_meaning: A NO vote does not authorize the construction of new ski trails or facilities on this forest preserve land, and the project cannot move forward.
